page.title: 15RUSKINGTON PAST AND PRESENT2
page.content: The doctor's surgery in Church View is built on what was Peatman's farm yard. The present village "Tuck Shop" has replaced the old cobbler's shop remembered as having had a thatched roof and a stable type door. Next door was the blacksmith's forge owned and run by a Mr Lilley. Westcliffe House, which is close by, sold home made ice- cream from a side window. What is now the co-operative shop once housed the post office run by a Mr Wilson. This street,once known as Post Office Street, has been renamed Church Street. A Miss Dove ran the sweet shop on Silver Street, this is now the chemist's shop. Mary and May Jackson ran a ladies hairdressing business from a hut on Rectory Road. Mr Tom Jackson still continued-
